info.name: Freshservice
info.description:
This collection makes heavy use of the variables in the collection. You should specify your API key in the authorization section of the collection as the username in the Basic auth type and the password field should remain empty.

While you can edit the endpoints etc with the value, editing the fields in the collection variables can make it easier to transition between each request type as needed.

The entirety of the API documentation can be found here: [https://api.freshservice.com/](https://api.freshservice.com/#custom-objects)

Inside each folder, a direct link to the corresponding section of the API documentation is provided as well if there is one.

body.raw:
{ "title": "Email Service Outage", "body_html": "

Service will be up and running in 2 hours

query.description: If a workspace_id is not specified as a URL parameter, only announcements from the primary workspace will be included in the response. If workspace_id is specified as 0, announcements from across all workspaces will be included in the response. Applicable only to accounts on the Employee Support Mode.

query.description: ID of the workspace to which the service item belongs. If not specified, it will be defaulted to the ID of the primary workspace. This attribute is applicable only to accounts on the Employee Support Mode.

The keywords for which the solution articles have to be searched.
Example: Vpn issue
By default, the API will search the articles for the user whose API key is provided. If you want to search articles for a different user, please provide their user_email.
If the returned results are more than per_page, you can use the page parameter to fetch subsequent pages.
The number of results to return per page. By default, the value is set to 30.
